page.title: 17ADDINGTON HILLS_ S.CROYDON
page.content: The Addington Hills, found 3 kilometres south_east of the town centre,form an extensive area of woodland and{recreational}space.They rise to a maximum of 450 feet above sea level,and the viewing platform on top gives an excellent{panoramic view} of much of the south London suburbs.This makes it a popular visiting spot and so it has large car parks and a snack bar/restaurant.Horse riding,walking and jogging are the main{leisure}pastimes,but there is also a trim_trail consisting of a circuit of fitness exercises using wooden apparatus. Nearby are some of the most{exclusive {residences}in Croydon ,nestling down private roads in the wooded hills.Many have private swimming pools and cost over Â£250,000.
